basics.name: Omar Abdelbadie
basics.label: Data & Machine Learning Engineer
basics.summary: From prototype to production, I value data-driven reactive architecture and clean functional code. I construct pipelines that transform data into impactful insights and products. An outspoken team player and quick learner, I thrive in collaborative, fast-paced environments, tackling challenging problems with exceptional communication skills.

work.name: OneLogin
highlights: Solely maintained a suite of microservices comprising a machine learning-based Account Takeover Protection core product feature.
Worked closely with Ops team to migrate AWS Elasticsearch indexes, cutting bill by >75% while maintaining service performance.
Wrote whitepaper on the significance of a Unified Identity Platform, IAM, and Zero-Trust Architecture in the years to come.
work.summary: I quickly took over maintaining a complex microservices suite amidst resource challenges. Inspiring colleagues and a period of high attrition motivated me. I facilitated cross-team communication using Msft Teams, engaging stakeholders across the company in a unique way. Leading process improvement meetings, we drove a swift, impactful change adopted company-wide.

work.name: Flexe
work.summary: Instilled a love of test-driven development, actionable metrics, and DevOps ownership under our mission-driven, transparent leadership (heavily ex-Amazon)
highlights: Led the design and development of a new Order Management System feature, unlocking new mid-complexity customers with over 70,000 orders per month
Building and designing features for a rapidly growing product / customer base
Full-stack duties spanning a tech stack of Typescript, Ruby, and Scala
Infrastructure-as-code, microservice architecture, clean API design

work.name: MAANA
highlights: Optimized 4 AI Azure Kubernetes Microservices by implementing asynchronous calls and reducing image sizes by >70%
Streamlined customer ETL workflows by building a text annotation dashboard for custom Named Entity Recognition
Led research and design of API for External UI Integration feature
Delivered first-in-class training material for Top Oil Company on proprietary data modeling platform
work.summary: I successfully transitioned from development to a data-science focused role. I supported my team of talented data scientists by handling infrastructure, integration, and frontend tasks. Under Chief Scientist Steve's leadership, we flourished in a creative and enjoyable environment, shielded from upper management politics.

work.name: General Assembly
highlights: Coached 4 students through 12 weeks of homework/labs/projects in Data Science (scikit-learn, Tensorflow, spaCy), Engineering (Spark, web-scraping, AWS) and Visualization (Tableau, Seaborn).
Facilitated a 0% dropout rate and successful placement into Data Science roles.

volunteer.summary: Mentored and tutored formerly incarcerated men and women to enter the tech industry.

awards.title: College & Departmental Honors
awards.summary: Computational Neuroscience Training Program | Thesis (UW VisCog Lab): Attention and the Pupillary Light Response

publications.name: Smarter, Better, Faster, Longer: The Efficacy and Mechanisms of Cognitive Enhancement
publications.publisher: Grey Matters: UW Undergraduate Neuroscience Journal
publications.summary: An in-depth look at three effective methods of cognitive enhancement- meditation, medication, and brain-computer interfaces
